item.title: Farah add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Touch comes before sight, before speech. It is the first language and the last, and it always tells the truth." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Farah add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "A word after a word after a word is power." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Farah add a quote by Aimee Bender
item.description: "My eyelids are my own private cave, he murmured. That I can go to anytime I want." -- Aimee Bender

item.title: Farah add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Principles and logic didn't give birth to reality. Reality came first, and the principles and logic followed." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Farah add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "I wonder which is preferable, to walk around all your life swollen up with your own secrets until you burst from the pressure of them, or to have them sucked out of you, every paragraph, every sentence, every word of them, so at the end you're depleted of all that was once as precious to you as hoarded gold, as close to you as your skin - everything that was of the deepest importance to you, everything that made you cringe and wish to conceal, everything that belonged to you alone - and must spend the rest of your days like an empty sack flapping in the wind, an empty sack branded with a bright fluorescent label so that everyone will know what sort of secrets used to be inside you?" -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Farah add a quote by Kathryn Stockett
item.description: "Stuart needs "space" and "time," as if this were physics and not a human relationship." -- Kathryn Stockett
